description: This file defines the DashboardPage component for a React-based frontend application. It manages displaying available service requests to mechanics, allowing them to accept requests, with functions for data fetching, state management, and rendering UI elements.

methods.name: statusBadge(status)
methods.description: Returns a styled span element displaying the status label for a given request status.

methods.name: renderVehicleCell(vehicle)
methods.description: Generates a string label for a vehicle, combining make and model, or returns a placeholder if unavailable.

methods.name: DashboardPage({ user })
methods.description: React functional component that renders the dashboard page with available requests, managing state for requests, errors, and loading status, and handling user interactions for accepting requests.

ctags.name: [ { key: "id", header: "Request", render: (r) => <Link className="link" to={`/requests/${r.id}`}>{r.id.slice(0, 8)}</ { key: "createdAt", header: "Created", render: (r) => new Date(r.createdAt).toLocaleString() }, { key: "vehicle", header: "Vehicle", render: (r) => renderVehicleCell(r.vehicle), }, { key: "status", header: "Status", render: (r) => statusBadge(r.status) }, { key: "action", header: "Action", render: (r) => ( <Button size="sm" onClick={() => accept(r.id)} disabled={busyId === r.id}> {busyId === r.id ? "Accepting..." : "Accept"} </ ), }, ]
